The pitch features short square boundaries, plenty of bounce, and pace to make strokeplay simple for the batters.\n\nIn the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL 2024), Mumbai Indians (MI) will host Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in Match 55 on Monday at the esteemed Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Mumbai Indians, led by Hardik Pandya, has had a terrible start to the IPL 2024 season. With just three wins in 11 games, the team is positioned last in the points standings.\n\nOn the other hand, with six victories in ten games, Sunrisers Hyderabad, led by Pat Cummins, have had an incredible journey thus far. Right now, SRH are ranked fourth in the points table. With another win, SRH will move one step closer to the playoff stage.\n\nMumbai's Wankhede Stadium is known for favouring batters. The pitch features short square boundaries, plenty of bounce, and pace to make strokeplay simple for the batters. It is expected that the pitch helps the fast bowlers in the first half of the game during the powerplay. It will allow them to take advantage of seam movement and take a few wickets. The pitch is unlikely to provide any assistance to the spinners.\n\nThe game is usually anticipated to be highly scoring. In order for the batters to score runs, they must take advantage of the assistance the surface offers. This ground is all about the toss, and whichever team wins usually chooses to bowl first and chase in this wicket.", "source": {"uri": "insidesport.in", "dataType": "news", "title": "Inside Sport Suryakumar was limping between the wickets during a sensational knock of 102 not out in 51 balls in MI's 7-wicket hammering of the SunRisers. However, the World No. 1 T20I batter said it was nothing but a bit of fatigue and rust due to the high-octane contests in the ongoing season.\n\nMI vs SRH, IPL 2024 Highlights | Scorecard\n\nSuryakumar Yadav did not let the niggle in the middle hinder his run-scoring form as he hit 6 sixes and 12 boundaries in a knock that left his batting partner 14Tilak Varma and the rest of the world in awe. Suryakumar hit the winning runs in style as he smashed one into the stands, also bringing up his 6th T20 century.\n\n\"I've been doing this after very long time. After 14th December this is the first time I fielded for 20 overs and batted for 18. But I'm alright. Only tiredness,\" Suryakumar Yadav said after winning the Player of the Match award.\n\nSuryakumar had missed the first couple of matches for MI in IPL 2024 as he needed more time to recover from a long injury layoff. Suryakumar underwent sports hernia surgery earlier in the year and missed the home series against Afghanistan. He last played for India in December when leading India in a T20I series in South Africa.\n\nIPL 2024: Points Table\n\nThe World No. 1 T20I batter, who has been picked in India's T20I squad, said the hundred on Monday was an important knock for him in the lead-up to the showpiece event.\n\nSuryakumar has 334 runs in 9 matches with four 50-plus scores, but he had not been able to stitch a string of consistent scores before the first week of May -- 56 against KKR and 102 not out against SRH.\n\n\"I feel it was the need of the hour for me to win. Three wickets were down and I needed to play till the end. Knew that dew was heavy and I had to bat till the seam came off. Traditional shots came from the Mumbai school of arts. I knew what to do when the ball was seaming and then brought out all the shots which I practice. I feel the intent would've been the same,\" Suryakumar said, explaining the method behind the madness.\n\nSuryakumar's wide array of shots was on display as he hit the SunRisers pacers with his unconventional style. His takedown of Marco Jansen in the 7th over changed the momentum in favour of MI on Monday. {"uri": "8114165402", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "16:52:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T16:52:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T16:52:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.47843137383461, "url": "http://uniindia.com/news/sports/srh-struggle-to-put-competitive-total-against-mi-dominant-bowling/3194024.html", "title": "SRH struggle to put competitive total against MI dominant bowling", "body": "Mumbai, May 6 (UNI) SunRisers Hyderabad encountered a formidable challenge in setting a competitive total against the Mumbai Indians in Match 55 of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024, despite a spirited performance from Travis Head.\n\nAs the innings unfolded, Head emerged as the standout performer for SunRisers Hyderabad, showcasing his batting prowess amidst the collapse of the team's batting order. However, despite Head's valiant efforts, SRH struggled to build a substantial total, managing to reach only 173/8 in their allotted 20 overs.\n\nThe inability to capitalise on Head's contribution was attributed to the relentless pressure exerted by Mumbai Indians' fielding unit. Mumbai's fielders executed their plans meticulously, thwarting SRH's attempts to accelerate the scoring rate.\n\nThe innings began with SRH openers, Abhishek Sharma and Head, displaying a strong intent to lay a solid foundation. While Sharma provided stability in the early overs, Head impressed with a brisk 48 off just 30 balls, including a flurry of boundaries.\n\nHowever, Mumbai Indians' bowlers quickly turned the tide in their favor, led by the experienced wrist-spinner Piyush Chawla who picked up three wickets. The wickets fell at regular intervals, and SRH found themselves struggling at 96/5 by the 12th over, courtesy of Mumbai's disciplined bowling performance.\n\nIn a pivotal moment, Mumbai Indians' skipper, Hardik Pandya, showcased his bowling prowess, claiming three crucial wickets for a mere 31 runs in his four-over spell. Pandya's exceptional display further bolstered Mumbai's dominance on the field, silencing any doubts surrounding his abilities.\n\nDespite their best efforts, SunRisers Hyderabad fell short in posting a competitive total against Mumbai Indians, highlighting the latter's formidable bowling attack and fielding prowess.\n\nAs the IPL 2024 season progresses, both teams will aim to build on their performances, with Mumbai Indians looking to maintain their winning momentum and SRH striving for a comeback in the tournament. At Stake For Beleaguered Mumbai Indians As They Face Resurgent Sunrisers Hyderabad", "body": "The Hardik Pandya-led outfit are at rock bottom after a campaign that has gone awry with just three wins and eight losses out of the 11 games played so far.\n\nThe Mumbai Indians would be looking to salvage some pride going into their game against playoff contenders Sunrisers Hyderabad in their IPL face-off at the Wankhede Stadium, here on Monday.\n\nThe Hardik Pandya-led outfit are at rock bottom after a campaign that has gone awry with just three wins and eight losses out of the 11 games played so far.\n\nTo make matters worse, the manner of their defeat in the previous game left a lot to be desired as they failed to chase down a target of 170 on a Wankhede pitch where batting does get a lot easier in the second half of the evening.\n\nWith the exception of Suryakumar Yadav, who slammed a creditable half-century, the rest of the MI batters flopped and would be eager to regain some form against SRH, who are pumped up after a nerve-wracking one-run win against Lucknow Super Giants in their last game.\n\nPandya's leadership has come under a fair amount of flak with former cricketers questioning his tactics during the game.\n\nThe MI skipper, who switched on a record transfer fee from Gujarat Titans, has been under immense pressure with the fans disenchanted with the replacing of the five-time IPL-winning captain Rohit Sharma.\n\nAs the defeats piled on, Pandya has been struggling to get the team's fortunes going and the campaign has fluttered in the process.\n\nHowever, there is sound backing for Pandya among the young MI batters like Naman Dhir, who vouched for his backing.\n\n\" He always backs every youngster and supports me in batting and bowling. He is a very good guy,'' Dhir added.\n\nWith the Playoffs out of their reach now, the Mumbai Indians might rest a few key players and test their bench strength. However, Dhir is not very sure about that happening.\n\n\"Right now there is no such plan. It is upto the management what decision they take with regard to the playing XI. Even me playing tomorrow (Monday) remains to be seen, it will get confirmed tomorrow (Monday) only,'' he added.\n\nLooking back at their defeat against Kolkata Knight Riders, Dhir felt it was a match that they should have won and there were no demons in the pitch as such.\n\n\" It wasn't a surprise as such. The wicket was a bit damp when we were batting but overall it was a good batting wicket. I think we did not bat as well as we should have and we should have chased down the target. Wankhede everyone expects a good batting track.\n\nThe Sunrisers, who are currently fourth on the table, would be looking to put it across MI and strengthen their chances of reaching the Playoffs with four matches to go.\n\nAfter their thrilling one-run victory against Lucknow Super Giants, SRH would be in a great mindset to go out and execute their plans.\n\n\"It has surely given us a psychological boost. When the game went to the last couple of overs and to get over the line. For us, we were lucky that we were on the right side of it. It gives us a positive boost. {"uri": "8111096788", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-04", "time": "12:39:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-04T12:39:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-04T12:38:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4313725531101227, "url": "https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/story/ipl-2024-mi-vs-kkr-suryakumar-yadav-prep-talk-rinku-singh-2535252-2024-05-04", "title": "Suryakumar Yadav gives 'prep talk' to KKR's Rinku Singh after MI vs KKR", "body": "Suryakumar is part of India's T20 World Cup squad, while Rinku missed out\n\nMI batter Suryakumar Yadav was seen sharing a few words with KKR's Rinku Singh after their two sides' clash in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 on May 3 at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. In the video uploaded by MI's official social media handle, Suryakumar could be seen giving a few tips to Rinku and KKR wicket-keeper KS Bharat after the match. The high-value fixture on Friday, saw the Shreyas Iyer-led in-form KKR side snap their Wankhede curse with a brilliant victory over MI by 24 runs and strengthen their grip on second spot in the points table.\n\nBatting first, KKR could only set a target of 170 runs for MI on top of some resilient batting from Venkatesh Iyer, who scored 70 off 52 balls, and impact sub Manish Pandey's 42 off 31 balls. However, MI's batting unit could not replicate their bowling brilliance and were bundled for just 145 runs, which featured Suryakumar's 53 runs off 35 balls knock being the home side's best individual batting figure. {"uri": "2024-05-346895098", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-06", "time": "19:45:52", "dateTime": "2024-05-06T19:45:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-06T19:36:52Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.4235294163227081, "url": "https://www.sportskeeda.com/cricket/news-i-think-14th-december-today-day-i-fielded-20-overs-batted-almost-18-overs-suryakumar-yadav-second-ipl-ton", "title": "\"I think after 14th December, today is the day where I fielded for 20 overs and batted for almost 18 overs\" - Suryakumar Yadav on his second IPL ton", "body": "Mumbai Indians (MI) batter Suryakumar recorded his second IPL hundred after scoring an unbeaten 102 runs off 51 deliveries in the win over the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH). It came at the Wankhede Stadium on Monday, May 6.\n\nSuryakumar Yadav rescued MI from 31-3, with Tilak Varma playing the perfect second fiddle. The right-handed batter had to be patient initially as Pat Cummins and Bhuvneshwar Kumar were bowling a potent spell. However, in typical fashion, it didn't take too long for him to break the shackles and bat in his usual tempo.\n\nAfter five consecutive dot balls to open the innings, the No.1 T20 batter proceeded to hit six boundaries off his next nine deliveries to shift the momentum completely. As the partnership between Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma blossomed, it became certain that MI would claim the win.\n\nAt one point, however, it seemed like the right-handed batter might just miss out on the ton. He made a final push with three consecutive boundaries off Cummins in the 17th over. He then hit a six against T Natarajan to reach the landmark three-figure and seal the points win.\n\nSuryakumar Yadav spoke about the importance of the knock after coming from a significant injury layoff after being adjudged as Player of the Match for his exploits.\n\nHe said:\n\n\"I've been doing this after a very long time. I think after 14th December, today is the day where I fielded for 20 overs and batted for almost 18 overs. So, it is a little bit tired, but hopefully tomorrow it will be better. I feel that it was the need of the hour today, three wickets down when I came in and someone had to be there till the end, and that is what I did.\"\n\nDecember 14 marked the date for the third T20I between India and South Africa, the contest where Suryakumar Yadav had suffered the fateful injury. Leading the side, he had scored his fourth T20I hundred, guiding India to 201-7. But he twisted his ankle while fielding as India skittled out the hosts for just 95 runs.\n\nThe ace batter largely played as an impact sub for the majority of the tournament after missing the first few matches for MI at the start. He hadn't received clearance from the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru following his recovery from an ankle injury and a hernia operation.\n\n\"I knew that the dew was heavy, and once the seam goes off, it will be easy for a batter to play\" - Suryakumar Yadav\n\nSuryakumar Yadav had an inconsistent 2024 campaign up until this point, which began with a duck against the Delhi Capitals (DC). He scored fifties against the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) and the Punjab Kings (PBKS) in winning causes. But there wasn't much noteworthy across the rest of his campaign.\n\n\"I knew that the dew was heavy, and once the seam goes off, it will be easy for a batter to play, so I just enjoyed my time. I played a lot of first-class cricket for Mumbai and a lot of games at the Wankhede, I know what's the right option when the ball is seaming. When the ball stopped seaming, I played all my shots which I practice in the nets,\" Suryakumar said.\n\nThe hundred comes at an excellent time for Team India as the 2024 T20 World Cup inches closer. The incident took place ahead of the Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) clash on May 3.\n\nSuryakumar is renowned for his ability to play the 'Supla' shot, where the batter paddles the full delivery from a pacer over the fine-leg region. The stroke has been vital to the success of the 33-year-old in the shortest format where he is ranked No.1 in the world in T20Is.\n\nMI's Twitter handle shared a video where Suryakumar Yadav taught Brevis the 'Supla' shot and also mentioned:\n\n\"Out of 10 times, 3 times you will connect, other 7 times you will not.\"\n\nWhile Dewald Brevis has been relegated to the bench in MI's recent games, the 21-year-old South African played two games at the start of the season, recording scores of 46 and 0.\n\nOn the other hand, Suryakumar missed MI's opening three games due to recovering from his injury. This was Mumbai Indians' fourth win of the season.\n\nSuryakumar Yadav owned the night with a scintillating hundred as he paved the way for Mumbai Indians' victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL 2024. Having won just three matches in 11 outings before this, Mumbai Indians had their backs stacked against the wall. On top of that, a batting failure had seen them succumb to a loss at home in their last match. They were up against a side that had struck what is now the second-highest IPL total earlier this season. With every odds stacked against them, the five-time champions found a way to bounce back and hand the Sunrisers Hyderabad, one of the teams in contention to make the playoffs, a seven-wicket defeat. Probably such a performance, especially from the bat of Suryakumar Yadav, has come a bit late, but Indian cricket fans would be happy that it has arrived in time with the ICC T20 World Cup approaching. IPL 2024 Points Table Updated With Net Run Rate.\n\nHaving won the toss, Mumbai Indians opted to bowl first and Sunrisers Hyderabad's fiery opening partnership between Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head yielded 56 runs before the former had to make his way back to the crease after edging behind to a Jasprit Bumrah delivery. Debutant Anshul Kamboj thought he had Travis Head only for the no-ball siren to go off and turn his happiness to gloom. He did manage to get the wicket of Mayank Agarwal, who made his comeback in this match. Mumbai Indians kept picking up wickets at regular intervals, not allowing the Sunrisers' batting to gain any momentum whatsoever. Hardik Pandya (3/32) and Piyush Chawla (3/33) did the bulk of the damage in the middle overs before a 19-ball 37-run stand between Pat Cummins and Sanvir Singh saw the visitors post 173/8. Viral Moments From MI vs SRH IPL 2024 Match: Rohit Sharma's Dejected Reaction, Suryakumar Yadav's Flying Kiss and Other Highlights From Mumbai Indians vs Sunrisers Hyderabad Clash.\n\nIn response, Mumbai Indians' lost their top three with just 31 runs on the board, giving fans a flashback of what happened at this venue against KKR few days ago. This time, though, Suryakumar did not fail to take his team over the line. He and Tilak Varma stitched an undefeated 143-run partnership off 79 balls, which helped Mumbai Indians chase down the target in 17.2 overs. Suryakumar completed the run chase with a six over covers which also fetched him a century, his second in the IPL off 51 balls, a knock that included 12 fours and six sixes. As Mumbai Indians gain confidence from this win, Sunrisers Hyderabad's chances of finishing inside the top four took a blow and now they would look to do their best in the three remaining matches. This was Mumbai Indians' fourth win of the season.\n\nSuryakumar Yadav owned the night with a scintillating hundred as he paved the way for Mumbai Indians' victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in IPL 2024. Having won just three matches in 11 outings before this, Mumbai Indians had their backs stacked against the wall. On top of that, a batting failure had seen them succumb to a loss at home in their last match. They were up against a side that had struck what is now the second-highest IPL total earlier this season. With every odds stacked against them, the five-time champions found a way to bounce back and hand the Sunrisers Hyderabad, one of the teams in contention to make the playoffs, a seven-wicket defeat. Probably such a performance, especially from the bat of Suryakumar Yadav, has come a bit late, but Indian cricket fans would be happy that it has arrived in time with the ICC T20 World Cup approaching. IPL 2024 Points Table Updated With Net Run Rate.\n\nHaving won the toss, Mumbai Indians opted to bowl first and Sunrisers Hyderabad's fiery opening partnership between Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head yielded 56 runs before the former had to make his way back to the crease after edging behind to a Jasprit Bumrah delivery. Debutant Anshul Kamboj thought he had Travis Head only for the no-ball siren to go off and turn his happiness to gloom. He did manage to get the wicket of Mayank Agarwal, who made his comeback in this match. Mumbai Indians kept picking up wickets at regular intervals, not allowing the Sunrisers' batting to gain any momentum whatsoever. Hardik Pandya (3/32) and Piyush Chawla (3/33) did the bulk of the damage in the middle overs before a 19-ball 37-run stand between Pat Cummins and Sanvir Singh saw the visitors post 173/8. Viral Moments From MI vs SRH IPL 2024 Match: Rohit Sharma's Dejected Reaction, Suryakumar Yadav's Flying Kiss and Other Highlights From Mumbai Indians vs Sunrisers Hyderabad Clash.\n\nIn response, Mumbai Indians' lost their top three with just 31 runs on the board, giving fans a flashback of what happened at this venue against KKR few days ago. This time, though, Suryakumar did not fail to take his team over the line. He and Tilak Varma stitched an undefeated 143-run partnership off 79 balls, which helped Mumbai Indians chase down the target in 17.2 overs. Suryakumar completed the run chase with a six over covers which also fetched him a century, his second in the IPL off 51 balls, a knock that included 12 fours and six sixes. As Mumbai Indians gain confidence from this win, Sunrisers Hyderabad's chances of finishing inside the top four took a blow and now they would look to do their best in the three remaining matches.
